cards.back: Extracting insights from data using scientific methods, statistics, and programming.

cards.front: What is the most important language for data science?
cards.back: Python - due to its simplicity and extensive libraries.
A subset of AI that automates analytical model building from data.
AI is broader (encompassing ML and other approaches), ML is a subset focused on learning from data.
Datasets too large or complex for traditional data processing tools.

title: Python Libraries
description: Essential Python libraries for data science

cards.back: Numerical computing, multi-dimensional arrays, and mathematical functions.
Data manipulation and analysis with DataFrame and Series structures.
Creating static, animated, and interactive visualizations.
A machine learning library providing tools for predictive data analysis.
An interactive computing environment for creating documents with live code.

title: Data Preparation
description: Cleaning and preparing data for analysis

cards.back: Removing errors, inconsistencies, and irrelevant data from datasets.
Extract, Transform, Load - the process of preparing data for analysis.
Data points that are not available or recorded for a variable.
Scaling numeric variables to a standard range, usually 0 to 1.
Creating new input features from existing data to improve model performance.
Exploratory Data Analysis - analyzing datasets to summarize main characteristics.

cards.front: What is a histogram used for?
cards.back: Showing the frequency distribution of a single continuous variable.

cards.front: What is a scatter plot used for?
cards.back: Displaying the relationship between two continuous variables.
A statistical measure of the relationship between two variables.

cards.front: What is a box plot used for?
cards.back: Showing data distribution, median, quartiles, and potential outliers.
The average of a set of numbers, calculated by summing and dividing by count.
A measure of data spread around the mean; square root of variance.
A bell-shaped probability distribution symmetric around the mean.
Testing claims about populations using sample data and statistical methods.
The probability of observing data if the null hypothesis is true.
Learning from labeled training data to predict outputs for new inputs.
Predicting continuous numerical values based on input features.
Predicting discrete categories or classes for input data.
When a model performs well on training data but poorly on new data.
A technique to assess model performance by splitting data multiple ways.
Finding patterns in data without labeled examples or supervision.
Grouping similar data points together based on characteristics.
A centroid-based clustering algorithm that partitions data into k clusters.
Principal Component Analysis - reduces dimensionality while preserving variance.
Finding data points that deviate significantly from normal behavior.
A subset of ML using neural networks with multiple hidden layers.
A computing system inspired by biological neural networks.
An algorithm for training neural networks by calculating gradients.
An open-source framework for building and training ML models.
A Python-based scientific computing package for deep learning.
Protecting personal information from unauthorized access and misuse.
Systematic errors that can disadvantage certain groups or produce unfair results.
General Data Protection Regulation - EU regulation for data protection.
Research that can be replicated and verified by others.
Managing data availability, usability, integrity, and security.
Making a trained model available for use in production applications.
Machine Learning Operations - applying DevOps to ML development.
Tracking model performance and behavior in production environments.
Comparing two versions of a model or feature to determine which performs better.
Updating a model with new data to maintain performance over time.
